newsitem.title: USA: Clarify falls after tax rate forecast.
newsitem.headline: Clarify falls after tax rate forecast.

text.p: Clarify Inc shares fell 20 percent in early trading Wednesday after the company said it expected its income tax rate to jump sharply in the 1997 first quarter.

Clarify said late yesterday that its effective tax rate should rise to 37 percent in the first quarter from 20 percent in the 1996 fourth quarter because the company had used up its federal and state operating loss carryforwards.
The operating loss carryforwards were used to cut its 1996 taxes.
Clarify yesterday reported earnings of $0.13 a share in the 1996 fourth quarter, up from $0.03 a year earlier. For the year, earnings rose to $0.38 a share from $0.09.
The company was not immediately available for comment.
